info.description: Connect to your Priceloop Data through our API.
info.title: Priceloop-API

post.description:
# Plugin Webhooks

This API allows you to register a webhook endpoint that receives plugin events from our platform.
All events will be sent as *POST* requests to the provided webhook url.

In case your webhook endpoint is down or responds with non-success status codes, we will retry to deliver the event up to 10 times over a time period of 1 hour.

## Registration/Confirmation

After registering, you will receive a first message on your webhook endpoint to confirm the registration.
The registration message looks like this:
```json
{
  "SubscribeURL": "https://..."
}
```

You have to make a *GET* request to the `SubscribeURL` in order to receive further events.

## Events

After confirmation, you will start receiving the desired plugin events.
The event messages look like this:
```json
{
  "event" : "PluginInstalled",
  "pluginName" : "ape",
  "workspaceName" : "some-workspace-name"
}
```
```json
{
  "event" : "PluginUninstalled",
  "pluginName" : "ape",
  "workspaceName" : "some-workspace-name"
}
```
```json
{
  "event" : "PluginTokensUpdated",
  "pluginName" : "ape",
  "workspaceName" : "some-workspace-name"
}
```

get.summary: Get all details about your workspace
Gets the current state of the import job
Get details about your existing external function

post.description: Create external functions, specifying the function name, runtime, return type and the paremeter types. This API endpoint returns a url, to which you can upload your function code. You can do a PUT request on the returned url, e.g.: curl -XPUT -T <zip-file> '<url>'.

put.description: This API endpoint returns a url, to which you can upload your function code. You can do a PUT request on the returned url, e.g.: curl -XPUT -T <zip-file> '<url>'.
put.summary: Update the code of an existing external function

get.summary: Get details about a plugin installation

post.summary: Create or update data of a plugin installation

put.summary: Set status of a plugin installation

post.summary: Set external data of a plugin installation

get.description: Drops and recreates the ape-tables with our expected schema. Deprecated - please use create-tables (and provide a schema) instead.

get.summary: Get plugin tokens for a workspace
Get the metadata of a table

put.summary: Change column position in a table

post.summary: Add a data column to a table
Add an expression column to a table

put.description: Change whether a column is locked (non-editable) in the GUI (webapp).
put.summary: Change whether a column is gui-locked
Change column visibility in a table

post.description: This API endpoint returns a url, to which you can upload your csv file. You can do a PUT request on the returned url, e.g.: curl -XPUT -T <csv-file> '<url>'.
post.summary: Upload a CSV file into a table

get.summary: Get the data of a table

get.description: This API endpoint returns a url, to which you can upload your csv file. You can do a PUT request on the returned url, e.g.: curl -XPUT -T <csv-file> '<url>'.
get.summary: Upload a CSV file into a table
